p: This difference equation form is particularly easy to handle numerically and can be straightforwardly solved in a spreadsheet. Fig. 5.2a shows the solutions to Eqs. 5.2– 5.4 over 50 years with a 1-week timestep. Parameters are set so that an infection with a basic reproductive number of 5 and a 1-week duration of infection is spreading in a population of 100,000 individuals. The figure illustrates how this model shows damped oscillations towards a stable state. The same is true for the ODE version of this model.
